headache.name: Migraine
headache.description: A neurological condition characterized by recurrent headaches, often accompanied by other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
headache.aid: Treatment may involve medications to manage symptoms and prevent attacks, lifestyle changes to avoid triggers, and in some cases, preventive medications.

headache.name: Tension headache
headache.description: A type of headache characterized by a dull, aching pain that can be felt on both sides of the head.
headache.aid: Treatment may involve over-the-counter pain relievers, lifestyle changes, and stress management techniques.

headache.name: Cluster headache
headache.description: A type of headache that occurs in cyclical patterns, with periods of frequent attacks followed by periods of remission.
headache.aid: Treatment may involve medications to manage symptoms and prevent attacks, as well as oxygen therapy and nerve blocks in some cases.

fever.name: Influenza
fever.description: A viral infection that can cause fever, cough, sore throat, body aches, and other symptoms.
fever.aid: Treatment may involve antiviral medications, over-the-counter medications to manage symptoms, and rest and fluids to help the body recover.

fever.name: Malaria
fever.description: A parasitic infection that can cause recurrent episodes of fever, chills, and flu-like symptoms.
fever.aid: Treatment may involve medications to kill the parasites and manage symptoms, as well as preventive measures such as mosquito nets and insect repellent.

rash.name: Contact dermatitis
rash.description: A type of rash that occurs when the skin comes into contact with an irritant or allergen.
rash.aid: Treatment may involve avoiding irritants, using moisturizers and topical corticosteroids, and in severe cases, oral medications or light therapy.

rash.name: Eczema
rash.description: A chronic skin condition that can cause dry, itchy patches of skin.
rash.aid: Treatment may involve avoiding irritants, using moisturizers and topical corticosteroids, and in severe cases, oral medications or light therapy.

fatigue.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
fatigue.description: A debilitating condition characterized by persistent fatigue that is not relieved by rest and is not due to another underlying medical condition.
fatigue.aid: Treatment may involve a combination of medications, lifestyle changes, and cognitive-behavioral therapy to manage symptoms.

fatigue.name: Anemia
fatigue.description: A condition in which the body does not have enough red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to fatigue and weakness.
fatigue.aid: Treatment may involve iron supplements, blood transfusions, or other medications to address the underlying cause.

fatigue.name: Depression
fatigue.description: A mood disorder that can cause feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and fatigue.
fatigue.aid: Treatment may involve therapy, medications, or a combination of both to manage symptoms.

chest pain.name: Heart attack
chest pain.description: A medical emergency in which blood flow to the heart is blocked, causing chest pain, shortness of breath, and other symptoms
chest pain.aid: Treatment may involve medications to dissolve blood clots and restore blood flow, as well as procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery.

chest pain.name: Angina
chest pain.description: A type of chest pain that occurs when the heart muscle does not receive enough blood and oxygen.
chest pain.aid: Treatment may involve medications to manage symptoms and reduce the risk of complications, as well as lifestyle changes to improve heart health.

shortness of breath.name: Asthma
shortness of breath.description: A chronic respiratory condition characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to shortness of breath, wheezing, and coughing.
shortness of breath.aid: Treatment may involve inhalers or nebulizers to open the airways, as well as medications to manage inflammation and prevent attacks.

shortness of breath.name: Pneumonia
shortness of breath.description: An infection of the lungs that can cause fever, cough, shortness of breath, and other symptoms.
shortness of breath.aid: Treatment may involve antibiotics, rest, and fluids to help the body fight the infection and recover.

nausea.name: Gastroenteritis
nausea.description: An infection or inflammation of the digestive tract that can cause nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and other symptoms.
nausea.aid: Treatment may involve rest, fluids, and medications to manage symptoms and prevent dehydration.

nausea.name: Migraine
nausea.description: A neurological condition characterized by recurrent headaches, often accompanied by other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
nausea.aid: Treatment may involve medications to manage symptoms and prevent attacks, lifestyle changes to avoid triggers, and in some cases, preventive medications.

cough.name: Acute bronchitis
cough.description: An inflammation of the airways that can cause coughing, chest discomfort, and other symptoms.
cough.aid: Treatment may involve rest, fluids, and over-the-counter medications to manage symptoms, as well as antibiotics in some cases.

cough.name: Pneumonia
cough.description: An infection of the lungs that can cause fever, cough, shortness of breath, and other symptoms.
cough.aid: Treatment may involve antibiotics, rest, and fluids to help the body fight the infection and recover.

abdominal pain.name: Gastritis
abdominal pain.description: An inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause abdominal pain, nausea, and other symptoms.
abdominal pain.aid: Treatment may involve medications to reduce stomach acid and manage symptoms, as well as lifestyle changes to avoid triggers.

abdominal pain.name: Irritable bowel syndrome
abdominal pain.description: A chronic digestive disorder characterized by abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in bowel habits.
abdominal pain.aid: Treatment may involve dietary changes, stress management techniques, and medications to manage symptoms.
